The probability of liking spicy food and dark room is 22%. Is the chance of dark room larger when observing liking spicy food?

Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Liking spicy food has a direct effect on room. The candle has a direct effect on room. The overall probability of liking spicy food is 26%. The probability of not liking spicy food and dark room is 41%. The probability of liking spicy food and dark room is 22%. Is the chance of dark room larger when observing liking spicy food?

This suggests that the chance of dark room is larger when not observing liking spicy food.<|eot_id|>
